name: WASP-39
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-39 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-39 is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.9 times its radius. It is located 750.16 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-39 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-39 system


WASP-39 b

WASP-39 b was discovered by the SuperWASP observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-39 b is 89.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-39 b is 14.235 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-39 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-39, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP.
